subject: p17189198
History: Recent multifocal pneumonia. New concerns of recurrent infection.
Findings: There is hilar congestion and diffuse bilateral ground glass opacities, most predominant at the bases, slightly improved from prior exam, and most consistent with pulmonary edema. An underlying pneumonia cannot be fully excluded. There are trace bilateral pleural effusions. There is no pneumothorax. The cardiac silhouette is moderately enlarged and unchanged from the prior exam. The mediastinal contours are normal.
Impression: Bilateral ground glass opacities and small bilateral pleural effusions are consistent with moderate pulmonary edema. In the proper clinical setting, a pneumonia cannot be excluded. Can consider a repeat chest radiograph after diuresis.
